meanings.sent1: I enjoy alphabeting my bookshelf to find my favorite books easily.
meanings.sent2: She spent the afternoon alphabeting her recipe cards for better organization.
meanings.sent3: The librarian was alphabeting the books so fast, she almost alphabeted herself!
meanings.sent4: His mind was alphabeting the list of tasks like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The teacher showed the students how alphabeting can simplify finding words in the dictionary.

meanings.definition: The act of putting words or letters in alphabetical order.
meanings.sent1: Alphabeting is essential for quickly locating information in a dictionary.
meanings.sent2: The alphabeting of the index made it easier to navigate the document.
meanings.sent3: The competition for alphabeting the words in the list was surprisingly intense.
meanings.sent4: In the world of words, alphabeting is like arranging a colorful bouquet.
meanings.sent5: The alphabeting of the names on the list made them stand out clearly.
